funded\r"}},"addMoneyPool(address)":{"details":"Each token costs 500 DAI and each token represents a share of the loan\r","params":{"_addressToFund":"Address of the user to be the Student\r","_name":"Name of the Student\r","_profAccount":"Github account of the Student\r","_studentId":"Id of the student\r","_university":"University in which the Student is attending to\r","_uri":"Used to store the JSON with the data of the Student\r"}},"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See `IERC20.allowance`."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See `IERC20.approve`.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See `IERC20.balanceOf`."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in `IERC20.approve`.     * Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in `IERC20.approve`.     * Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"params":{"_operator":"Address of authorized operator\r","_owner":"The owner of the Tokens\r"},"return":"True if the operator is approved, false if not\r"},"isOwner()":{"return":"true if \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdmsg.sender\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is the owner of the contract.\r"},"owner()":{"return":"the address of the owner.\r"},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.\r It will not be possible to call the functions with the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdonlyOwner\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\r modifier anymore.\r"},"repayLoan()":{"details":"First you need to call an approve transaction\r"},"requestLoan(uint256)":{"details":"For this usecase the Student can request a fixed amount of 50000 DAI\r and have a deadline of 5 years to repay the Loan\r","params":{"_interestLoan":"Interest rate the student is willing to pay\r"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"MUST emit the ApprovalForAll event on success.\r","params":{"_approved":"True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval\r","_operator":"Address to add to the set of authorized operators\r"}},"setStableCoinAddress(address)":{"params":{"_addressCoin":"Address of the StableCoin Contract\r"}},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See `IERC20.totalSupply`."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See `IERC20.transfer`.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See `IERC20.transferFrom`.     * Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of `ERC20`;     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.\r","params":{"newOwner":"The address to transfer ownership to.\r"}},"withdrawLoan(uint256)":{"params":{"_amount":"Amount the user is willing to withdraw\r"}},"withdrawRepaidLoan(address)":{"params":{"_addressFunded":"Address of the funded student\r"}}},"title":"Providentia, providing students with loan\r"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"acceptLoan(address)":{"notice":"Function to accept the proposed loan\r"},"addMoneyPool(address)":{"notice":"Function used to add money to the pool for the Student\r"},"addSchool(address,string)":{"notice":"Function used to add the school, only the owner can add school, to prevent misbehavior\r"},"addStudent(address,uint256,string,uint256,string,string,string,string)":{"notice":"Function used to add the Student\r"},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"notice":"Queries the approval status of an operator for a given owner.\r"},"renounceOwnership()":{"notice":"Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,\r thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.\r"},"repayLoan()":{"notice":"Function used by the Student to repay the Loan\r"},"requestLoan(uint256)":{"notice":"Function used to initiate a Loan process and get funded\r"},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"notice":"Enable or disable approval for a third party (\"operator\") to manage all of the caller's tokens.\r"},"setStableCoinAddress(address)":{"notice":"Function used to upgrade the contract address of DAI in case it changes\r"},"withdrawLoan(uint256)":{"notice":"Function to withdraw the loan of devdoc.details: See https://providentia.netlify.com/ Note: Some values are hardcoded in order to represent a specific usecase

addMoneyPool(address).details: Each token costs 500 DAI and each token represents a share of the loan

params._addressToFund: Address of the user to be funded

params._universityName: Name of the university to add

params._addressStudent: Address of the Student to add
params._university: University in which the Student is attending to
params._uri: Used to store the JSON with the data of the Student

approve(address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.approve`.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in `IERC20.approve`.     * Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in `IERC20.approve`.     * Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: True if the operator is approved, false if not

isOwner().return: true if ����msg.sender���� is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the ����onlyOwner���� modifier anymore.

repayLoan().details: First you need to call an approve transaction

requestLoan(uint256).details: For this usecase the Student can request a fixed amount of 50000 DAI and have a deadline of 5 years to repay the Loan

params._interestLoan: Interest rate the student is willing to pay

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: MUST emit the ApprovalForAll event on success.

params._approved: True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval
params._operator: Address to add to the set of authorized operators

transfer(address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.transfer`.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.transferFrom`.     * Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of `ERC20`;     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

params._amount: Amount the user is willing to withdraw

devdoc.title: Providentia, providing students with loan

acceptLoan(address).notice: Function to accept the proposed loan

addMoneyPool(address).notice: Function used to add money to the pool for the Student

addSchool(address,string).notice: Function used to add the school, only the owner can add school, to prevent misbehavior

addStudent(address,uint256,string,uint25.notice: Function used to add the Student

isApprovedForAll(address,address).notice: Queries the approval status of an operator for a given owner.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

repayLoan().notice: Function used by the Student to repay the Loan

requestLoan(uint256).notice: Function used to initiate a Loan process and get funded

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).notice: Enable or disable approval for a third party ("operator") to manage all of the caller's tokens.

setStableCoinAddress(address).notice: Function used to upgrade the contract address of DAI in case it changes

withdrawLoan(uint256).notice: Function to withdraw the loan of the Student

withdrawRepaidLoan(address).notice: Function for the Investors to withdraw their share
